chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin J. Fuerst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Columbia County.
Apply 17 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge are PAID IN FULL.  Remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the minor victim listed in the Criminal Complaint, except with either parents approval and under their conditions.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colin J. Fuerst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
17 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Columbia County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No unsupervised contact with minor females.
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  minor victim listed in the criminal complaint, except with either parents approval and under their conditions.
DNA sample to be provided.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail and refund the balance.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.    

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.    

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

records.addlTxt:
Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colin J. Fuerst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   
Matter originally scheduled for a Competency Hearing.

Both State and Defense have received a copy of Dr. Jurek's Competency Evaluation (finding the defendant competent to proceed).
State is in agreement to the findings of Dr. Jurek.
Defense will stipulate to Dr. Jurek's finding of competence.
Neither State or Defense is requesting any additional evaluation.

Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
filed by Dr. Jurek.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 02/11/16.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colin J. Fuerst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   

Both state and defense have a copy of Dr. Rawski's evaluation that now finds the defendant competent to proceed.
State does not contest/challenge Dr. Rawski's findings of competency.
Atty. Menden continues to challange Dr. Rawski's findings of Competency and requests the matter proceed to a Competency Hearing.
Atty. Menden requests the court order a different examiner (Dr. Anthony Jurek) to conduct an evaluation.

Court appoints Dr. Jurek to conduct an independant competency evaluation on an outpatient basis.
Dr. Jurek's report to be filed by:  03/03/16.

Court withholds making any findings at this time and matter will proceed to the Competency Hearing (Currently Scheduled for 03/10/16 @ 2 pm.).

filed by Dr. Rawski.
Competency hearing at 03-10-2016 02:00 pm

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colin J. Fuerst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  

Defendant was previously referred to the OCRP.
State and Defense both have copies of the Competency Evaluation filed by Dr. Rawski (through the OCRP - 90 Day Program).
Dr. Rawski's Evaluation states the defendant has now reached competency and is able to proceed.
Defense is objecting/contesting Dr. Rawski's Evaluation (maybe looking for the court to order another evaluation).

Court orders the Defendant continue with the OCRP until the court makes it's decision as to competency.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Order for Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) - To the Out Patient Restoration Program.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 08/13/15.

08/13/15 - Clerk faxed information required to both WCS and BCI for OCRP (Confirmations Received).
Review hearing on October 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Colin J. Fuerst in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   
Court to Address - Competence Evaluation.

Competency evaluation states the defendant is currently not competent to proceed, however, is likely to regain competency.
Defense is in agreement that the defendant is currently not competent, however not sure if the defendant will ever regain competency.
State is in agreement with the evaluation.
Court receives the Evaluation.
Court finds the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time, and is likely to regain competency.
Court order the defendant into the out patient restoration program.
Matter is hereby suspended pending the defendant regaining competency.
  Review hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
filed by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
